name: Birria de Chivo
description: A traditional dish from Tonalá, Jalisco, cooked in earth ovens, with goat meat marinated with chiles and spices.

name: Corn Tamale
description: A sweet tamale made from tender corn, served hot and often accompanied by cream or condensed milk.

name: Cazuela Tamales
description: Tamales cooked in a clay pot, giving them a special flavor and different texture.

name: Beef Cracklings
description: Cracklings made from beef skin, served as a snack or in tacos.

name: Basket Tacos
description: Tacos placed in a basket to keep them warm, with traditional fillings like potato, cracklings, beans, and adobo.

name: Wild Boar Broth
description: An exotic dish made from wild boar meat cooked in a broth with chiles and spices.

name: Pumpkin Stem Soup
description: Soup made with tender pumpkin stems and pumpkin flowers, creating a nutritious and flavorful dish.

name: Tequila and Mezcal
description: Traditional drinks from Jalisco, very popular in Tonalá, enjoyed alone or as part of cocktails.

name: Artisanal Ice Creams
description: Ice creams with traditional flavors, ideal for cooling down on a hot day.

name: Tapatian Enchiladas
description: Tortillas filled with chicken, covered with chile sauce, cream, and cheese, a local variant of a classic dish.
